linic. Clinicians working in postnatal clinics should therefore review the results of delivery VL.
o If the baby is still admitted to hospital, ward staff should ensure that the results are reviewed.
• Once the result of the delivery VL is known, prophylaxis should be adjusted accordingly.
• If the mother’s delivery HIV VL < 50 c/mL regardless of feeding choice:
o Re-classify the infant as low-risk
